column4: root@ubuntu:/usr# mysql -u root ERROR 1045 (28000): Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost' (using password: NO)
mysql -u root -p then hit enter when it asks you for a password.
is this the first time you have logged into mysql?
what do you get with sudo apt-get install mysql-server
first, get out of the root shell you are in.
if that doesn't work, sudo apt-get remove --purge mysql-server
now, mysql -u root -p and hit enter, then at the Password: prompt, hit enter again (don't type anything).
what do you get when you type lsb_release -a
did you ever set a root password in the system?
both, did you set either one?
when you login to mysql as root, try your system's root password.
you did something else, because there is no way that mysql would not let you in.
did you only install it from repos, or did you install it from somewhere else, didn't work, then installed it from the repos again?
